dialogues.text: This was a real drag to him. He didn't need to negotiate. what the fuck were we going to do if he didn't buy it? Se the streets. Fuck that. The deal is done. The Man hands over the money and waits then leaves with the drugs. (v.o)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We settled on sixteen thousand pounds. He had a lot more suitcase, but it was better than nothing. And just for a felt really great, like we were all in it together, like like it meant something. A moment like that, it can touch inside, but it doesn't last long, not like sixteen thousa pounds.

dialogues.text: The pub is crowded with afternoon drinkers. Renton, Spud, Begbie sit drinking. Begbie is still keeping a firm hand which now holds the money. SICK BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Fuck you. If you can't hold a pint, you shouldn't be in t mate. Now fuck off. Begie drops the remaining three pints. Renton is seated as before, avoidin Begbie addresses him. Hey, Rent-boy, bring us down a smoke. Renton does not move. SICK BOY

dialogues.text: Now, I've justified this to myself in all sorts of ways: a big deal, just a minor betrayal, or we'd outgrown each you know, that sort of thing, but let's face it, I ripped off.
